alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 15 at 11:33PM MDT until August 16 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM MDT/345 AM CDT/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in northeast Colorado, Yuma. In northwest Kansas, Cheyenne. In southwest Nebraska, Dundy. * WHEN...Until 245 AM MDT /345 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1133 PM MDT /1233 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wray, Laird and Vernon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
